Module com.example.javaproject
Package com.example.javaproject

Class Grid

java.lang.Object
com.example.javaproject.Grid
public class Grid extends Object
The Grid class represents a grid for the game.

    • switchTokenValue

      public void switchTokenValue(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Swapping two tokens on the game grid.
      Parameters:
      x1 - Value of the x-coordinate of the first token.
      y1 - Value of the y-coordinate of the first token.
      x2 - Value of the x-coordinate of the second token.
      y2 - Value of the y-coordinate of the second token.

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Checking if two tokens can be swapped.
      Parameters:
      x1 - Value of the x-coordinate of the first token.
      y1 - Value of the y-coordinate of the first token.
      x2 - Value of the x-coordinate of the second token.
      y2 - Value of the y-coordinate of the second token.
      Returns:
      True if at least one of the two tokens is a grey tile (with a value of 0) and the other is a token with a value greater than or equal to 0.

    • move

      public boolean move(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Swapping two tokens if the move is allowed.
      Parameters:
      x1 - Value of the x-coordinate of the first token.
      y1 - Value of the y-coordinate of the first token.
      x2 - Value of the x-coordinate of the second token.
      y2 - Value of the y-coordinate of the second token.
      Returns:
      True if the exchange is done.

    • GetArrayGrid

      public int GetArrayGrid(int x, int y)
      Returns the value on the token with coordinates (x,y).
      Parameters:
      x - Value of the x-coordinate of the token.
      y - Value of the y-coordinate of the token.
      Returns:
      The value on the token with coordinates (x,y).

    • isSolve

      public boolean isSolve(Grid gridInit)
      Checks if the game is solved.
      Parameters:
      gridInit - The initial grid already solved.
      Returns:
      True if the game is solved.
